author: Staff Reporter
text:
Devotees from various places thronged Sri Subramaniaswamy Temple at Tiruchendur in the district on Monday and witnessed the Masi car festival celebrated with religious fervour and gaiety

They offered special prayers since early morning hours. The festival began with flag-hoisting on February 13. Devotees pulled three cars at 6.30 a.m., 7.15 a.m. and at 9.30 a.m. The car festival proceedings, which commenced at 6.30 a.m., continued until 11 p.m.

‘Theppa Thiruvizha' will be held at this temple on Tuesday. The twelve-day ‘Masi Thiruvizha’ would conclude on Wednesday. The district administration along with Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department officials made necessary arrangements for the devotees. Adequate police personnel had been deployed. More bus services were also arranged by the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation to facilitate devotees to attend the festival.
title: Fervour marks car festival
